intro: Impatiens trichantha, commonly known as the hairy impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are ovate and often covered with fine, hairy glands, giving it a distinctive appearance. Impatiens trichantha is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
